creditline: Gift of Gordon Brodfuehrer in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts
description: flat rectangular slab platter with two runner legs on underside; top decorated with cartoonish painted image of squatting figures with very tightly placed facial features eating from small bowls; muted pastel colors on cream ground; underside is brown
text: Satō Satoshi has made himself a name by producing witty, playful. He achieves this by creating unusual but functional forms that he embellishes with caricature-like, simple drawings, executed in vivid colors. Recalling literati works of art, his ceramics are therefore called Satō Nanga. This is one of his larger works illustrating a vivid scene of monks attending a feast.
title: Feast of Priests
